body.summary: Georgia Tech Makerspaces have been at the front of creative and novel ways of letting students be the leaders and driving force of designing, building, and discovering new ideas. Hear what leaders from the Invention Studio, The Hive, and more have to say about the rich history and direction Makerspaces are going in the future.

Miscellaneous projects, interviews, and articles. This collection houses articles without accompanying interviews, as well as content that the Empathy Bytes team has collected outside of the context of a larger project. This includes older, uncategorized content from previous years of work.

The Georgia Tech Distance Math program has paved the way for innovation in distance learning for outstanding students pursuing higher education. Discover the history and techniques used in its development, the obstacles that needed to be overcome, and what the future holds for this growing way of learning.

nodes.title: COVID Freshmen and Reconnecting to Campus

body.summary: This fall, as the Georgia Tech community, and the nation as a whole, begin a slow return to what life once was, our second-year Jackets face a unique paradigm. Through the project “COVID FRESHMAN” and (Re)Connecting to Campus, we will document their stories and the distinct challenges Georgia Tech second year’s are facing.
